---
name: backend-migrations
description: Create and manage Django database migrations following best practices for schema changes, data migrations, and zero-downtime deployments. Use this skill when running makemigrations or migrate commands, creating data migrations with RunPython, adding or removing database fields, renaming fields or tables, creating database indexes, squashing migrations, resolving migration conflicts, or working on files in any migrations/ directory.
---

## When to use this skill:

- When creating new Django migrations with makemigrations
- When writing data migrations using RunPython
- When adding, removing, or modifying model fields that require migrations
- When renaming database columns or tables
- When creating or modifying database indexes
- When planning zero-downtime migration strategies
- When squashing multiple migrations into one
- When resolving migration conflicts after merging branches
- When reviewing auto-generated migration files before committing
- When working on files in */migrations/ directories
- When using RunSQL for complex database operations
- When rolling back migrations during development or troubleshooting

# Backend Migrations

This Skill provides Claude Code with specific guidance on how to adhere to coding standards as they relate to how it should handle backend migrations.

## Instructions

For details, refer to the information provided in this file:
[backend migrations](../../../agent-os/standards/backend/migrations.md)
